description:
A message from our CEO - Terry Agnew

“When you work at RAC, you become an integral part of making WA a better place. As a member organisation, everything we do is for the benefit of our members, not shareholders.

"Whether it’s advocating for safer roads, building Australia’s first electric highway, trialling Australia’s first driverless bus or sponsoring the RAC Rescue helicopters, we look for opportunities to achieve more for our members and the WA community.

"Like our members, our people are very important to us. The work our people do is what makes RAC such a valued organisation in WA, so we invest in our people to help them be the best they can be.

"We provide career development, rewards and recognition programs and top-class health and safety initiatives for our people, including access to tools that enable a healthy work life balance. Our employees also enjoy all RAC member benefits, discounts on RAC products, corporate volunteering opportunities and an active social club.

If you would like to contribute to something bigger, we would love to hear from you.” 



At RAC we offer career opportunities that will allow you to give back and make a difference to our members and the WA community. We pride ourselves on employing the highest calibre of people to meet our member’s needs. RAC promotes healthy living and aims to protect health and safety of employees, members and visitors. RAC has been a part of the West Australian community since 1905. We are unique organisation, built by members for members. From our origins as a motoring club, we have grown to a diverse organisation of over 1,400 employees serving more than 1 million members with a range of products and services. RAC’s difference is that we are a mutual organisation, which means we can give back our profits for the benefit of our members and the WA community for the better. 


For the second year in a row, RAC Cervantes Holiday Park has won Gold in the Caravan & Holiday Parks category at 2018 WA Tourism Awards.

 


At 2018 International Day of Co-operatives. RAC is one of more than 2,100 co-operative and mutual enterprises operating across Australia.
